word: No longer will each one teach
parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A citizen, fellow-citizen. From polis; a townsman.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Little, small. Including the comparative mikroteros apparently a primary word; small (figuratively) dignity).

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
